intro: Hybanthus scariosus var. brevicaulis, commonly known as the short-stemmed hybanthus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic in shape and often have a rough texture. The species is noted for its unique floral structure and is of interest to botanists studying plant diversity in tropical regions.
